required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of FACoT for Individuals Post Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of a Novel Meta-cognitive-functional Intervention (FACoT) for Individuals Post Mild-moderate Stroke

brief_summary.textblock: To develop and assess the effectiveness of a novel cognitive-functional intervention (FACoT) in occupational therapy for people after mild to moderate stroke.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in scores of The Canadian Occupational Performance Measure (COPM)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention -10-13 weeks later) and time 2 (follow-up- three month later)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in scores of the Instrumental Activities of Daily Living (IADL) scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention, 10-13 weeks later) and between baseline to time 2 (follow-up- 3 month later)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in scores of Reintegration to Normal Living Index (RNL)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention, 10-13 weeks later) and between baseline to time 2 (follow-up-3 month later)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in scores of Short Form-12v2 Health Survey (SF-12v2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention, 10-13 weeks later) and between baseline to time 2 (follow-up- 3 month later)

secondary_outcome.measure: change in scoe of New general self efficacy scale (NGSE)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention, 10-13 weeks later) and between baseline to time 2 (follow-up- 3 month later)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in scores of Patient competency rating scale (PCRS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention, 10-13 weeks later) and between baseline to time 2 (follow-up- 3 month later)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in scores Self Regulation Skills Interview (SRSI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention, 10-13 weeks later) and between baseline to time 2 (follow-up- 3 month later)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in scores of Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention, 10-13 weeks later) and between baseline to time 2 (follow-up-3 month later)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in scores of Trail making test (TMT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention, 10-13 weeks later) and between baseline to time 2 (follow-up- 3 month later)
Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention, 10-13 weeks later) and between baseline to time 2 (follow-up-3 month later)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in scores of Dysexecutive Questionnaire (DEX)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention, 10-13 weeks later) and between baseline to time 2 (follow-up- 3month later)
Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention, 10-13 weeks later) and between baseline to time 2 (follow-up- 3 month later)

other_outcome.measure: National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS)

arm_group.description: treatment group will receive FACoT, that include one to one 10 treatment sessions. the treatment sessions will include: functional activities, cognitive activities and strategies (pencil-pen treatment), and behavioural strategies
control group receiving standard care - cognitive and functional assesment

intervention.description: The intervention will include: functional activities, cognitive activities and strategies (pencil-pen treatment), and behavioural strategies

criteria.textblock:
inclusion criteria:
- >18 years
- at least three years post stroke
- severity mild to moderate (NIHSSâ‰¤5)
- independent prior to the stroke
- can understand and speak Hebrew
Exclusion Criteria:
- with no other neurological or psychiatric conditions
- without dementia
